title: Publish your StoryQuest
body:
It's time to publish your StoryQuest! Open the quest.tres scene in your StoryQuest folder and fill out the title, description, and author fields in the Inspector. [[tutorial](https://github.com/endlessm/threadbare/discussions/649)]

**Acceptance Criteria**

- [ ] I have included a title and description of our StoryQuest in the quest.tres file.
- [ ] I have included the names of the individuals who contributed to this project.

title: Complete the StoryQuest GDD
body:
Make a copy of the [game design document (GDD) template](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1F-fu_NE3h_nHxf3Qu9EXaVcF_2bzLE4cxHTa8xADChs/edit?usp=sharing) and work with your team to customize it for your StoryQuest. Keep in mind, the GDD is a work in progress and can be edited throughout this learning experience. [[tutorial](https://github.com/endlessm/threadbare/discussions/600)]

**Acceptance Criteria**

- [ ] We recorded our initial StoryQuest Overview in the GDD.
- [ ] We recorded our initial Intro section in the GDD.
- [ ] We recorded our initial Mini-game section(s) in the GDD.
- [ ] We recorded our initial Outro section in the GDD.

title: Brainstorm StoryQuest ideas
body:
Collaborate with your team to brainstorm ideas for your StoryQuest. [[tutorial](https://github.com/endlessm/threadbare/discussions/628)]

**Acceptance Criteria**

- [ ] We have collaborated to create a collection of ideas for our StoryQuest (characters, narrative structure, mini-games, etc.)

title: Present your StoryQuest
body:
Present your finished StoryQuest.  [[tutorial](https://github.com/endlessm/threadbare/discussions/620)]

**Acceptance Criteria**

- [ ] We presented our StoryQuest to an audience beyond our own team.
- [ ] We explained the story, gameplay, and reflected on our experience in designing the StoryQuest.
- [ ] We answered questions from our audience.

title: Create your game pitch deck
body:
Create a short pitch deck that explains your game’s story, gameplay, and what makes it unique. This will help you share your project with others. [[tutorial](https://github.com/endlessm/threadbare/discussions/619)]

**Acceptance Criteria**

- [ ] We created a pitch deck  about the story, gameplay, and unique features.
- [ ] We pushed the final version to the project repository or shared folder.

title: [Optional] Add music and/or sound effects for mini-game 3
body:
Add background music and/or sound effects that fits the scene and helps to tell the story. [[tutorial](https://github.com/endlessm/threadbare/discussions/622)]

**Acceptance Criteria**

- [ ] I added new music and/or sound effects for this mini-game.
- [ ] I added new music and/or sound effects that match the game feel.
- [ ] I pushed the changes to a branch.
- [ ] I submitted a pull request for review.

title: [Optional] Add music and/or sound effects for mini-game 2
body:
Add background music and/or sound effects that fits the scene and helps to tell the story. [[tutorial](https://github.com/endlessm/threadbare/discussions/622)]

**Acceptance Criteria**

- [ ] I added new music and/or sound effects for this mini-game.
- [ ] I added new music and/or sound effects that match the game feel.
- [ ] I pushed the changes to a branch.
- [ ] I submitted a pull request for review.

title: Connect scene to scene
body:
Connect this scene to the next scene you've chosen for your StoryQuest (ex: combat scene, stealth scene, sequence puzzle scene, etc.). [[tutorial](https://github.com/endlessm/threadbare/discussions/624)]

**Acceptance Criteria**

- [ ] I connected two scenes without disrupting the flow of the gameplay.
- [ ] I confirmed through playtesting that our player character transitions correctly from scene to scene.
- [ ] I pushed the changes to a branch.
- [ ] I submitted a pull request for review.

title: Connect scene  to scene
body:
Connect this scene to the next scene you've chosen for your StoryQuest (ex: combat scene, stealth scene, sequence puzzle scene, etc.). [[tutorial](https://github.com/endlessm/threadbare/discussions/624)]

**Acceptance Criteria**

- [ ] I connected two scenes without disrupting the flow of the gameplay.
- [ ] I confirmed through playtesting that our player character transitions correctly from scene to scene.
- [ ] I pushed the changes to a branch.
- [ ] I submitted a pull request for review.

title: Create and replace art assets for mini-game 3
body:
Modify or add art assets for your Storyquest's game objects (props). [[tutorial](https://github.com/endlessm/threadbare/discussions/627)]

**Acceptance Criteria**

- [ ] I modified or replaced at least one object in the scene (such as a background prop like a tree or house that is not part of the tilemap, or an interactive object like a target or projectile).
- [ ] I created art assets that fit the aesthetic of our StoryQuest. 
- [ ] I pushed the changes to a branch. 
- [ ] I submitted a pull request for review.

title: Create and replace art assets for mini-game 2
body:
Modify or add art assets for your Storyquest's game objects (props). [[tutorial](https://github.com/endlessm/threadbare/discussions/627)]

**Acceptance Criteria**

- [ ] I pushed the changes to a branch. 
- [ ] I submitted a pull request for review.

title: Add narrative text for mini-game 3
body:
Integrate your own text or dialogue into the mini-game. [[tutorial](https://github.com/endlessm/threadbare/discussions/629)]

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- [ ] I integrated my narrative into the mini-game.
- [ ] I added narrative text and/or dialogue that is consistent with the narrative structure of our StoryQuest. 
- [ ] I pushed the changes to a branch.
- [ ] I submitted a pull request for review.

title: Modify mechanics for mini-game 3
body:
Explore and use the available mini-game components to customize the gameplay. [[tutorial](https://github.com/endlessm/threadbare/discussions/630)]

**Acceptance Criteria**

- [ ]  I added or modified one or more gameplay elements using an available node or component in the mini-game.
- [ ] I pushed the changes to a branch.
- [ ] I submitted a pull request for review.

title: Connect scene to scene
body:
Connect this scene to the next scene you've chosen for your StoryQuest (ex: combat scene, stealth scene, sequence puzzle scene, etc.). [[tutorial](https://github.com/endlessm/threadbare/discussions/624)]

**Acceptance Criteria**

- [ ] I submitted a pull request for review.

title: Refine your game
body:
Take action on the feedback gathered during the playtesting sessions. Polish your game and prepare it for launch! [[tutorial](https://github.com/endlessm/threadbare/discussions/618)]

**Acceptance Criteria**
- [ ] We prioritized and adjusted key aspects of our StoryQuest based on player feedback.
- [ ] We playtested the new changes.
- [ ] We pushed the changes to a branch.
- [ ] We submitted a pull request for review.

title: Gather and reflect on player feedback
body:
Analyze the notes from your playtesting sessions. What actions do you plan to take? Who will work on each task? [[tutorial](https://github.com/endlessm/threadbare/discussions/617)]

**Acceptance Criteria**
- [ ] We compiled our notes from each playtesting session.
- [ ] We created a plan for acting on the feedback received during each playtesting session.

title: Conduct playtesting sessions
body:
Conduct team and peer playtesting sessions. Be sure to collect reactions and suggestions for improvement. [[tutorial](https://github.com/endlessm/threadbare/discussions/616)]

**Acceptance Criteria**
- [ ] We conducted at least one playtesting session with our team and collected notes.
- [ ] We conducted at least one playtesting session with peers and collected notes.
- [ ] We conducted at least one playtesting session with a mentor and collected notes.

title: Connect scene to scene
body:
Connect the intro scene to the next scene you've chosen for your StoryQuest (ex: combat scene, stealth scene, sequence puzzle scene etc.) [[tutorial](https://github.com/endlessm/threadbare/discussions/611)]

**Acceptance Criteria**

- [ ] I connected two scenes without disrupting the flow of the gameplay.
- [ ] I confirmed through playtesting that our player character transitions correctly from scene to scene.
- [ ] I pushed the changes to a branch.
- [ ] I submitted a pull request for review.

title: Create and replace art assets for intro & outro
body:
Find and replace the placeholder background image that sits in the tilemap and add any additional art assets needed to match your StoryQuest. [[tutorial](https://github.com/endlessm/threadbare/discussions/605)]

**Acceptance Criteria**

- [ ] I added a new background image and any additional art assets.
- [ ] I created art assets that fit the aesthetic of our StoryQuest. 
- [ ] I pushed the changes to a branch. 
- [ ] I submitted a pull request for review.

title: Add narrative text for intro & outro
body:
Integrate your own text or dialogue into the intro and outro scenes. [[tutorial](https://github.com/endlessm/threadbare/discussions/604)]

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- [ ] I added the narrative text and/or dialogue to the intro and outro scenes.
- [ ] I added narrative text and/or dialogue that is consistent with the narrative structure of our StoryQuest. 
- [ ] I pushed the changes to a branch.
- [ ] I submitted a pull request for review.

title: Design and replace character(s) for intro & outro
body:
Design your own player character and integrate your new sprite frames into your StoryQuest. [[tutorial](https://github.com/endlessm/threadbare/discussions/602)]

**Acceptance Criteria**

- [ ] I modified or replaced all placeholder player_template sprite frames with my own character frames.
- [ ] I tested all character animations to ensure they are functional.
- [ ] I created character(s) that match the aesthetics of our StoryQuest.
- [ ] I pushed the changes to a branch.
- [ ] I submitted a pull request for review.

title: Redesign placeholder tilemap for intro & outro
body:
Design the layout for your intro and outro scenes. [[tutorial](https://github.com/endlessm/threadbare/discussions/601)]

Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] I used separate layers (eg, a base ground layer as well as a layer on top for a player path) to create a tile map.
- [ ] I created a tile map that fits the aesthetics and game feel of our StoryQuest.
- [ ] I created a tile map that allows for players to progress smoothly through the scene(s).
- [ ] I pushed the changes to a branch.
- [ ] I submitted a pull request for review.

title: Duplicate and rename the template folders and files
body:
**ONLY ONE TEAM MEMBER:** Find and duplicate the template folders and files and give your copies a new name to match your team's StoryQuest. One team member can do this for the whole team. [[tutorial](https://github.com/endlessm/threadbare/discussions/599)]

**Acceptance Criteria:**

- [ ] I duplicated and renamed the template folders and files and their contents have been successfully copied and placed in our StoryQuest folder.
- [ ] I have pushed my changes to our forked repo on GitHub.
